homes_hear_details: North Carolina has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) Energy Office is coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy on program design and implementation.
state_energy_office: North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality - State Energy Office

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For North Carolina, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Mecklenburg County (Charlotte), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $64,650. In Wake County (Raleigh), it is approximately $68,400.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For North Carolina, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Mecklenburg County (Charlotte), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $121,200. In Wake County (Raleigh), it is approximately $128,250.

net_metering: North Carolina does not have a traditional statewide net metering law. Duke Energy offers net metering for systems up to 1 MW under their Rider NM tariff, where customers receive a credit at the utility's avoided cost rate for excess generation, which is lower than the retail rate.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,500 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, windows, doors, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through regional community action agencies across the state.

programs.name: Duke Energy Residential Smart $aver
programs.amount: Up to $1,000 for heat pumps, $200 for smart thermostats, $400 for duct sealing
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, duct sealing, smart thermostats, attic insulation

programs.name: Duke Energy Home Energy Assessment
programs.amount: Free online energy assessment or reduced-cost in-home assessment
programs.eligible_items: Home energy evaluation identifying savings opportunities

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $600 for heat pumps, $200 for smart thermostats, $300 for insulation
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, smart thermostats, insulation, duct sealing

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Programs
programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $500 for qualifying equipment
